ActiveHourDCDBInstance.document: This API is used to remove the isolation of a pay-as-you-go TDSQL for MySQL instance.
ActiveHourDCDBInstance.name: Removes the isolation of pay-as-you-go TDSQL for MySQL instance

AssociateSecurityGroups.document: This API is used to associate security groups with Tencent Cloud resources in batches.
AssociateSecurityGroups.name: Associates security groups in batches

CancelDcnJob.document: This API is used to cancel DCN synchronization.
CancelDcnJob.name: Cancels DCN synchronization

CloneAccount.document: This API is used to clone an instance account.
CloneAccount.name: Clones instance account

CloseDBExtranetAccess.document: This API is used to disable public network access for a TencentDB instance, which will make the public IP address inaccessible. The `DescribeDCDBInstances` API will not return the public domain name and port information of the corresponding instance.
CloseDBExtranetAccess.name: Disables public network access

CopyAccountPrivileges.document:
This API is used to copy the permissions of a TencentDB account.
Note: Accounts with the same username but different hosts are different accounts. Permissions can only be copied between accounts with the same `Readonly` attribute.
CopyAccountPrivileges.name: Copies account permissions

CreateAccount.document: This API is used to create a TencentDB account. Multiple accounts can be created for one instance. Accounts with the same username but different hosts are different accounts.
CreateAccount.name: Creates an account

CreateDCDBInstance.document: This API is used to create a monthly subscribed TencentDB instance by passing in information such as instance specifications, database version number, and purchased duration.
CreateDCDBInstance.name: Creates a TDSQL instance

CreateHourDCDBInstance.document: This API is used to create pay-as-you-go TDSQL for MySQL instances.
CreateHourDCDBInstance.name: Creates pay-as-you-go TDSQL for MySQL instances

DeleteAccount.document: This API is used to delete a TencentDB account, which is uniquely identified by username and host.
DeleteAccount.name: Deletes an account

DescribeAccountPrivileges.document:
This API is used to query the permissions of a TencentDB account.
Note: Accounts with the same username but different hosts are considered as different accounts.
DescribeAccountPrivileges.name: Queries account permissions

DescribeAccounts.document: This API is used to query the list of accounts of a specified TencentDB instance.
DescribeAccounts.name: Queries account list

DescribeDBLogFiles.document: This API is used to get the list of various logs of a database, including cold backups, binlogs, errlogs, and slowlogs.
DescribeDBLogFiles.name: Gets the list of logs

DescribeDBParameters.document: This API is used to get the current parameter settings of a database.
DescribeDBParameters.name: Views database parameters

DescribeDBSecurityGroups.document: This API is used to query the security group information of an instance.
DescribeDBSecurityGroups.name: Queries the security group information of an instance

DescribeDBSlowLogs.document: This API is used to query the list of slow query logs.
DescribeDBSlowLogs.name: Queries slow query log list

DescribeDBSyncMode.document: This API is used to query the sync mode of a TencentDB instance.
DescribeDBSyncMode.name: Queries the sync mode

DescribeDCDBInstanceNodeInfo.document: This API is used to query the information of instance nodes.
DescribeDCDBInstanceNodeInfo.name: Queries instance node information

DescribeDCDBInstances.document:
This API is used to query the list of TencentDB instances. It supports filtering instances by project ID, instance ID, private network address, and instance name.
If no filter is specified, 10 instances will be returned by default. Up to 100 instances can be returned for a single request.
DescribeDCDBInstances.name: Queries the list of instances

DescribeDCDBPrice.document: This API is used to query the price of an instance before you purchase it.
DescribeDCDBPrice.name: Queries the purchase price of an instance

DescribeDCDBShards.document: This API is used to query the information of shards of a TencentDB instance.
DescribeDCDBShards.name: Queries shard information

DescribeDatabaseObjects.document: This API is used to query the list of database objects in a TencentDB instance, including tables, stored procedures, views, and functions.
DescribeDatabaseObjects.name: Queries database object list

DescribeDatabaseTable.document: This API is used to query the table information of a TencentDB instance.
DescribeDatabaseTable.name: Queries table information

DescribeDatabases.document: This API is used to query the database list of a TencentDB instance.
DescribeDatabases.name: Queries database list

DescribeDcnDetail.document: This API is used to query the disaster recovery details of an instance.
DescribeDcnDetail.name: Queries the disaster recovery details of an instance

DescribeFileDownloadUrl.document: This API is used to get the download URL of a specific backup or log file of a database.
DescribeFileDownloadUrl.name: Gets the backup/log download URL

DescribeFlow.document: This API is used to query task status.
DescribeFlow.name: Queries task status

DescribeOrders.document: This API is used to query TDSQL order information. You can pass in an order ID to query the TDSQL instance associated with the order and the corresponding task process ID.
DescribeOrders.name: Queries the order information

DescribeProjectSecurityGroups.document: This API is used to query the security group details of a project.
DescribeProjectSecurityGroups.name: Queries the security group details of a project

DestroyDCDBInstance.document: This API is used to terminate an isolated monthly-subscribed instance.
DestroyDCDBInstance.name: Terminates an isolated monthly-subscribed instance

DestroyHourDCDBInstance.document: This API is used to terminate a pay-as-you-go instance.
DestroyHourDCDBInstance.name: Terminates a pay-as-you-go instance

DisassociateSecurityGroups.document: This API is used to unassociate security groups from instances in batches.
DisassociateSecurityGroups.name: Unassociates security groups in batches

GrantAccountPrivileges.document:
This API is used to grant permissions to a TencentDB account.
Note: accounts with the same username but different hosts are different accounts.
GrantAccountPrivileges.name: Sets account permissions

InitDCDBInstances.document: This API is used to initialize instances, including setting the default character set and table name case sensitivity.
InitDCDBInstances.name: Initializes instance

IsolateDedicatedDBInstance.document: This API is used to isolate a dedicated TencentDB instance.
IsolateDedicatedDBInstance.name: Isolates a dedicated TencentDB instance

IsolateHourDCDBInstance.document: This API is used to isolate pay-as-you-go TDSQL for MySQL instances.
IsolateHourDCDBInstance.name: Isolates pay-as-you-go TDSQL for MySQL instances

KillSession.document: This API is used to kill the specified session.
KillSession.name: Kills the specified session

ModifyAccountDescription.document:
This API is used to modify the remarks of a TencentDB account.
Note: accounts with the same username but different hosts are different accounts.
ModifyAccountDescription.name: Modifies account remarks

ModifyAccountPrivileges.document:
This API is used to modify the permissions of a TencentDB instance account.

**Notes**
- Only the SELECT permission (that is, set the permission parameter to `["SELECT"]`) of the system database `mysql` can be granted.
- An error will be reported if read-write permissions are granted to a read-only account.
- If the parameter is not passed in, no change will be made to the granted table permissions. To clear the granted table permissions, set `Privileges` to an empty array.
ModifyAccountPrivileges.name: Modifies the permissions of a TencentDB instance account

ModifyDBEncryptAttributes.document: This API is used to modify the instance data encryption.
ModifyDBEncryptAttributes.name: Modifies the encryption attributes of the instance data

ModifyDBInstanceName.document: This API is used to modify instance name.
ModifyDBInstanceName.name: Modifies instance name

ModifyDBInstanceSecurityGroups.document: This API is used to modify the security groups associated with TencentDB.
ModifyDBInstanceSecurityGroups.name: Modifies the security groups associated with TencentDB

ModifyDBInstancesProject.document: This API is used to modify the project to which TencentDB instances belong.
ModifyDBInstancesProject.name: Modifies the project to which instances belong

ModifyDBParameters.document: This API is used to modify database parameters.
ModifyDBParameters.name: Modifies database parameters

ModifyDBSyncMode.document: This API is used to modify the sync mode of a TencentDB instance.
ModifyDBSyncMode.name: Modifies sync mode

ModifyInstanceNetwork.document: This API is used to modify instance network.
ModifyInstanceNetwork.name: Modifies instance network

ModifyInstanceVip.document: This API is used to modify instance VIP.
ModifyInstanceVip.name: Modifies instance VIP

ModifyInstanceVport.document: This API is used to modify instance Vport.
ModifyInstanceVport.name: Modifies instance Vport

ResetAccountPassword.document:
This API is used to reset the password of a TencentDB account.
Note: accounts with the same username but different hosts are different accounts.
ResetAccountPassword.name: Resets account password

SwitchDBInstanceHA.document: This API is used to start a source-replica switch of instances.
SwitchDBInstanceHA.name: Starts a source-replica switch of instances

TerminateDedicatedDBInstance.document: This API is used to terminate the isolated dedicated TDSQL instance.
TerminateDedicatedDBInstance.name: Terminates the dedicated TDSQL instance

UpgradeHourDCDBInstance.document: This API is used to upgrade a pay-as-you-go TDSQL for MySQL instance.
UpgradeHourDCDBInstance.name: Upgrades a pay-as-you-go TDSQL for MySQL instance.

members.document: The unique request ID, which is returned for each request. RequestId is required for locating a problem.

members.document: Instance ID in the format of dcdbt-ow728lmc, which can be obtained through the `DescribeDCDBInstances` API.
members.name: InstanceId

members.document: AccountName
members.name: UserName

members.document: Host that can be logged in to, which is in the same format as the host of the MySQL account and supports wildcards, such as %, 10.%, and 10.20.%.
members.name: Host

members.document: Account password. It must contain 8-32 characters in all of the following four types: lowercase letters, uppercase letters, digits, and symbols (()~!@#$%^&*-+=_|{}[]:<>,.?/), and cannot start with a slash (/).
members.name: Password

members.document: Whether to create a read-only account. 0: no; 1: for the account's SQL requests, the secondary will be used first, and if it is unavailable, the primary will be used; 2: the secondary will be used first, and if it is unavailable, the operation will fail; 3: only the secondary will be read from.
members.name: ReadOnly

members.document: Account remarks, which can contain 0-256 letters, digits, and common symbols.
members.name: Description

members.document:
If the secondary delay exceeds the set value of this parameter, the secondary will be deemed to have failed.
It is recommended that this parameter be set to a value greater than 10. This parameter takes effect when `ReadOnly` is 1 or 2.
members.name: DelayThresh

members.document: Whether to specify a replica server for read-only account. Valid values: `0` (No replica server is specified, which means that the proxy will select another available replica server to keep connection with the client if the current replica server doesn’t meet the requirement). `1` (The replica server is specified, which means that the connection will be disconnected if the specified replica server doesn’t meet the requirement.)
members.name: SlaveConst

members.document: Maximum number of connections. If left empty or `0` is passed in, the connections will be unlimited. This parameter configuration is not supported for kernel version 10.1.
members.name: MaxUserConnections

members.document: Instance ID, which is passed through from the input parameters.
members.name: InstanceId

members.document: Username, which is passed through from the input parameters.
members.name: UserName

members.document: Host allowed for access, which is passed through from the input parameters.
members.name: Host

members.document: Passed through from the input parameters.
members.name: ReadOnly

members.document: The unique request ID, which is returned for each request. RequestId is required for locating a problem.
members.name: RequestId

members.document:
AZs to deploy shard nodes. You can specify up to two AZs. When the shard specification is 1-source-2-replica, two of the nodes are deployed in the first AZ.
The current purchasable AZ needs be pulled through `DescribeDCDBSaleInfo` API.
members.name: Zones

members.document: Validity period in months
members.name: Period

members.document:
Shard memory size in GB, which can be obtained 
 by querying the instance specification through `DescribeShardSpec` API.
members.name: ShardMemory

members.document:
Shard storage size in GB, which can be obtained
 by querying the instance specification through `DescribeShardSpec` API.
members.name: ShardStorage

members.document:
Number of nodes in a single shard, which can be obtained
 by querying the instance specification through `DescribeShardSpec` API.
members.name: ShardNodeCount

members.document: The number of shards in the instance. Value range: 2-8. You can increase up to 64 shards by upgrading your instance.
members.name: ShardCount

members.document: The number of instances to be purchased
members.name: Count

members.document: Project ID, which can be obtained through the `DescribeProjects` API. If this parameter is not passed in, the instance will be associated with the default project.
members.name: ProjectId

members.document: VPC ID. If this parameter is left empty or not passed in, the instance will be created on the classic network.
members.name: VpcId

members.document: VPC subnet ID, which is required when `VpcId` is specified.
members.name: SubnetId

members.document: Database engine version. Valid values: `5.7`, `8.0`, `10.0`, `10.1`.
members.name: DbVersionId

members.document: Whether to automatically use vouchers. This option is disabled by default.
members.name: AutoVoucher

members.document: Voucher ID list. Currently, you can specify only one voucher.
members.name: VoucherIds

members.document: Security group ID
members.name: SecurityGroupId

members.document: Custom name of the instance
members.name: InstanceName

members.document: Whether IPv6 is supported
members.name: Ipv6Flag

members.document: Array of tag key-value pairs
members.name: ResourceTags

members.document: List of parameters. Valid values: `character_set_server` (character set; required); `lower_case_table_names` (table name case sensitivity; required; `0`: case-sensitive; `1`: case-insensitive); `innodb_page_size` (InnoDB data page size; default size: 16 KB); `sync_mode` (sync mode; `0`: async; `1`: strong sync; `2`: downgradable strong sync; default value: `2`).
members.name: InitParams

members.document: DCN source region
members.name: DcnRegion

members.document: DCN source instance ID
members.name: DcnInstanceId

members.document: Renewal mode. Valid values: `0` (Manual renewal, which is the default mode), `1` (Auto-renewal), `2` (Manual renewal, which is specified by users). If no renewal is required, set it to `0`.
members.name: AutoRenewFlag

members.document: Security group IDs in array. This parameter is compatible with the old parameter `SecurityGroupId`.
members.name: SecurityGroupIds

members.document:
Long order ID, which is used to call the `DescribeOrders` API.
 The parameter can be used to either query order details or call the user account APIs to make another payment when this payment fails.
members.name: DealName

members.document:
IDs of the instances you have purchased in this order. If no instance IDs are returned, you can query them with the `DescribeOrders` API. You can also use the `DescribeDBInstances` API to check whether an instance has been created successfully.
Note: This field may return null, indicating that no valid values can be obtained.
members.name: InstanceIds

members.document: The unique request ID, which is returned for each request. RequestId is required for locating a problem.
members.name: RequestId

members.document: Shard memory in GB, which can be obtained through the `DescribeShardSpec` API.
members.name: ShardMemory

members.document: Shard capacity in GB, which can be obtained through the `DescribeShardSpec` API.
members.name: ShardStorage

members.document: The number of nodes per shard, which can be obtained through the `DescribeShardSpec` API.
members.name: ShardNodeCount

members.document: The number of shards in the instance. Value range: 2-8. Upgrade your instance to have up to 64 shards if you require more.
members.name: ShardCount

members.document: The number of instances to be purchased
members.name: Count

members.document: Project ID, which can be obtained through the `DescribeProjects` API. If this parameter is not passed in, the instance will be associated with the default project.
members.name: ProjectId

members.document: VPC ID. If this parameter is left empty or not passed in, the instance will be created on the classic network.
members.name: VpcId

members.document: VPC subnet ID, which is required when `VpcId` is specified
members.name: SubnetId

members.document: The number of CPU cores per shard, which can be obtained through the `DescribeShardSpec` API.
members.name: ShardCpu

members.document: Database engine version. Valid values: `5.7`, `8.0`, `10.0`, `10.1`.
members.name: DbVersionId

members.document: AZs to deploy shard nodes. You can specify up to two AZs.
members.name: Zones

members.document: Security group ID
members.name: SecurityGroupId

members.document: Custom name of the instance
members.name: InstanceName

members.document: Whether IPv6 is supported
members.name: Ipv6Flag

members.document: Array of tag key-value pairs
members.name: ResourceTags

members.document: If you create a disaster recovery instance, you need to use this parameter to specify the region of the associated source instance so that the disaster recovery instance can sync data with the source instance over the Data Communication Network (DCN).
members.name: DcnRegion

members.document: If you create a disaster recovery instance, you need to use this parameter to specify the ID of the associated source instance so that the disaster recovery instance can sync data with the source instance over the Data Communication Network (DCN).
members.name: DcnInstanceId

members.document: List of parameters. Valid values: `character_set_server` (character set; required); `lower_case_table_names` (table name case sensitivity; required; 0: case-sensitive; 1: case-insensitive); `innodb_page_size` (InnoDB data page size; default size: 16 KB); `sync_mode` (sync mode; 0: async; 1: strong sync; 2: downgradable strong sync; default value: 2).
members.name: InitParams

members.document: ID of the instance to be rolled back
members.name: RollbackInstanceId

members.document: Rollback time
members.name: RollbackTime

members.document: Array of security group IDs (this parameter is compatible with the old parameter `SecurityGroupId`)
members.name: SecurityGroupIds

members.document: IDs of the instances you have purchased in this order. If no instance IDs are returned, you can query them with the `DescribeOrders` API. You can also use the `DescribeDBInstances` API to check whether an instance has been created successfully.
members.name: InstanceIds

members.document: Task ID, which can be used to query the creation progress
members.name: FlowId

members.document:
Order ID, which is used for calling the `DescribeOrders` API.
 The parameter can be used to either query order details or call the user account APIs to make another payment when this payment fails.
members.name: DealName

members.document: The unique request ID, which is returned for each request. RequestId is required for locating a problem.
members.name: RequestId

members.document: Username
members.name: UserName

members.document: Host from which a user can log in (corresponding to the `host` field for a MySQL user; a user is uniquely identified by username and host; this parameter is in IP format and ends with % for IP range; % can be entered; if this parameter is left empty, % will be used by default).
members.name: Host

members.document: User remarks
members.name: Description

members.document: Creation time
members.name: CreateTime

members.document: Last updated time
members.name: UpdateTime

members.document: Read-only flag. 0: no; 1: for the account's SQL requests, the replica will be used first, and if it is unavailable, the source will be used; 2: the replica will be used first, and if it is unavailable, the operation will fail.
members.name: ReadOnly

members.document:
If the replica delay exceeds the set value of this parameter, the replica will be considered to have failed.
Set this parameter to a value above 10. This parameter takes effect when `ReadOnly` is 1 or 2.
members.name: DelayThresh

members.document: Whether to specify a replica server for read-only account. Valid values: `0` (No replica server is specified, which means that the proxy will select another available replica server to keep connection with the client if the current replica server doesn’t meet the requirement). `1` (The replica server is specified, which means that the connection will be disconnected if the specified replica server doesn’t meet the requirement.)
members.name: SlaveConst

Async task flow ID when an async task is in progress on an instance
Note: this field may return null, indicating that no valid values can be obtained.
members.name: Locker

members.document: Public network access status. 0: not enabled; 1: enabled; 2: disabled; 3: enabling
members.name: WanStatus

members.name: IsAuditSupported

Indicates whether the instance uses IPv6
Note: this field may return null, indicating that no valid values can be obtained.

Private network IPv6 address

Public network IPv6 port

Public network IPv6 status
Note: this field may return null, indicating that no valid values can be obtained.

members.document:
DCN type. Valid values: 0 (null), 1 (primary instance), 2 (disaster recovery instance)
Note: this field may return null, indicating that no valid values can be obtained.
members.name: DcnFlag

members.document:
DCN status. Valid values: 0 (null), 1 (creating), 2 (syncing), 3 (disconnected)
Note: this field may return null, indicating that no valid values can be obtained.
members.name: DcnStatus

members.document:
The number of DCN disaster recovery instances
Note: this field may return null, indicating that no valid values can be obtained.

members.document: Type name. For example, if `Type` is `table`, `Object` indicates a specific table name; if both `DbName` and `Type` are specific names, it indicates a specific object name and cannot be `\*` or empty.

members.document: Access host allowed for a user. An account is uniquely identified by username and host.
members.name: Host

members.document: Database name. `\*` indicates that global permissions will be queried (i.e., `\*.\*`), in which case the `Type` and `Object ` parameters will be ignored
members.name: DbName

members.document:
Global permission. Valid values: `SELECT`, `INSERT`, `UPDATE`, `DELETE`, `CREATE`, `DROP`, `REFERENCES`, `INDEX`, `ALTER`, `CREATE TEMPORARY TABLES`, `LOCK TABLES`, `EXECUTE`, `CREATE VIEW`, `SHOW VIEW`, `CREATE ROUTINE`, `ALTER ROUTINE`, `EVENT`, `TRIGGER`, `SHOW DATABASES`, `REPLICATION CLIENT`, `REPLICATION SLAVE`.
Database permission. Valid values: `SELECT`, `INSERT`, `UPDATE`, `DELETE`, `CREATE`, `DROP`, `REFERENCES`, `INDEX`, `ALTER`, `CREATE TEMPORARY TABLES`, `LOCK TABLES`, `EXECUTE`, `CREATE VIEW`, `SHOW VIEW`, `CREATE ROUTINE`, `ALTER ROUTINE`, `EVENT`, `TRIGGER`. 
Table permission. Valid values: `SELECT`, `INSERT`, `UPDATE`, `DELETE`, `CREATE`, `DROP`, `REFERENCES`, `INDEX`, `ALTER`, `CREATE VIEW`, `SHOW VIEW`, `TRIGGER`.  
Field permission. Valid values: `INSERT`, `REFERENCES`, `SELECT`, `UPDATE`.
members.name: Privileges

members.document: Type. Valid values: `table`, `\*`. If `DbName` is a specific database name and `Type` is `\*`, the permissions of the database will be set (i.e., `db.\*`), in which case the `Object` parameter will be ignored
members.name: Type

members.document: Type name. For example, if `Type` is table, `Object` indicates a specific table name; if both `DbName` and `Type` are specific names, it indicates a specific object name and cannot be `\*` or empty
members.name: Object

members.document: If `Type` = table and `ColName` is `\*`, the permissions will be granted to the table; if `ColName` is a specific field name, the permissions will be granted to the field
members.name: ColName

members.name: InstanceIds

members.document: Parameter list. Valid values: character_set_server (character set; required); lower_case_table_names (table name case sensitivity; required; 0: case-sensitive, 1: case-insensitive); innodb_page_size (InnoDB data page; default size: 16 KB); sync_mode (sync mode; 0: async; 1: strong sync; 2: downgradable strong sync; default value: strong sync).
members.name: Params

members.name: Accounts

members.document:
Global permission. Valid values: "SELECT", "INSERT", "UPDATE", "DELETE", "CREATE", "PROCESS", "DROP", "REFERENCES", "INDEX", "ALTER", "SHOW DATABASES", "CREATE TEMPORARY TABLES", "LOCK TABLES", "EXECUTE", "CREATE VIEW", "SHOW VIEW", "CREATE ROUTINE", "ALTER ROUTINE", "EVENT", "TRIGGER".
Note: If the parameter is left empty, no change will be made to the granted global permissions. To clear the granted global permissions, set the parameter to an empty array.
members.name: GlobalPrivileges

members.document:
Database permission. Value range: "SELECT", "INSERT", "UPDATE", "DELETE", "CREATE", "DROP", "REFERENCES", "INDEX", "ALTER", "CREATE TEMPORARY TABLES", "LOCK TABLES", "EXECUTE", "CREATE VIEW", "SHOW VIEW", "CREATE ROUTINE", "ALTER ROUTINE", "EVENT", "TRIGGER".	
Note: If the parameter is not passed in, no change will be made to the granted stored procedure permissions. To clear the granted database permissions, set `Privileges` to an empty array.
members.name: DatabasePrivileges

members.document:
Database table permission. Valid values of `Privileges`: `SELECT`, `INSERT`, `UPDATE`, `DELETE`, `CREATE`, `DROP`, `REFERENCES`, `INDEX`, `ALTER`, `CREATE VIEW`, `SHOW VIEW`, `TRIGGER`.
Note: If the parameter is not passed in, no change will be made to the granted view permissions. To clear the granted table permissions, set `Privileges` to an empty array.
members.name: TablePrivileges

members.document:
Column permission in the table. Valid values: "SELECT", "INSERT", "UPDATE", "REFERENCES".
Note: If the parameter is not passed in, no change will be made to the granted column permissions. To clear the granted column permissions, set `Privileges` to an empty array.
members.name: ColumnPrivileges

members.document:
Database view permission. Valid values of `Privileges`: `SELECT`, `INSERT`, `UPDATE`, `DELETE`, `CREATE`, `DROP`, `REFERENCES`, `INDEX`, `ALTER`, `CREATE VIEW`, `SHOW VIEW`, `TRIGGER`.
Note: If the parameter is not passed in, no change will be made to the granted table permissions. To clear the granted view permissions, set `Privileges` to an empty array.
members.name: ViewPrivileges

members.document: Async task ID, which can be used in the [DescribeFlow](https://www.tencentcloud.com/document/product/237/16177) API to query the async task result.

Previously set value, which is the same as `value` after the parameter takes effect. If no value has been set, this field will not be returned.

Whether restart is required. false: no;
true: yes.

members.document: Instance ID to be upgraded in the format of dcdbt-ow728lmc, which can be obtained through the `DescribeDCDBInstances` API.
members.name: InstanceId

members.document:
Upgrade type. Valid values:
  • `ADD`: Add a new shard
  • `EXPAND`: Upgrade the existing shads
  • `SPLIT`: Split data of the existing shads to the new ones
members.name: UpgradeType

members.document: Add shards when `UpgradeType` is `ADD`.
members.name: AddShardConfig

members.document: Expand shard when `UpgradeType` is `EXPAND`.
members.name: ExpandShardConfig

members.document: Split shard when `UpgradeType` is `SPLIT`.
members.name: SplitShardConfig

members.document: Switch start time in the format of "2019-12-12 07:00:00", which is no less than one hour and within 3 days from the current time.
members.name: SwitchStartTime

members.document: Switch end time in the format of "2019-12-12 07:15:00", which must be later than the start time.
members.name: SwitchEndTime

members.document: Whether to retry automatically. Valid values: `0` (no), `1` (yes).
members.name: SwitchAutoRetry

members.document: The list of new AZs specified in deployment modification. The first one is the source AZ, and the rest are replica AZs.
members.name: Zones
